title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement [INSERT CONTACT METHOD]. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/ code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https:// www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: date_helper
text: create dummy data experimentation Using dummy dataset created , finds earliest latest years dataset, useful showing referring date range dataset.
code: # Fix the randomness to ensure same data is generated every time set.seed(123)  dummy_data <- data.frame(   date = sample(seq(as.Date("2000/01/01"), by = "week", length.out = 10 * 12 * 4),     size = 52 * 4   ) ) year_date(dummy_data, date, type = "earliest") #>   year #> 1 2000 year_date(dummy_data, date, type = "latest") #>   year #> 1 2009

title: Categorise continuous age into age groups — as_age_groups
code: as_age_groups(   var,   min = 0,   max = 120,   by = 10,   grouping_method = c("user_defined", "ons_1", "ons_2", "nhs_survey") )

title: Categorise continuous age into age groups — as_age_groups
text: var Name variable vector min Numeric, specifying minimum age first age group. Age values lower returned missing values (NA) max Numeric, specifying upper end last age group Numeric, increment age categories grouping_method String, specifying method used grouping age categories. Details different methods available : "user_defined", "ons_1", "ons_2", "nhs_survey" ... TODO

title: Categorise continuous age into age groups — as_age_groups

title: Calculate frequencies of groups per month — calc_monthly_freq
code: calc_monthly_freq(   data,   by,   date_var_name,   .drop_latest_month = TRUE,   .calc_year_month_day_vars = TRUE )

title: Calculate frequencies of groups per month — calc_monthly_freq
text: data Data Grouping variables used group_by date_var_name String specifying date variable, needs class date .drop_latest_month Logical, specifying whether drop recent month .calc_year_month_day_vars Logical, specifying whether calculate separate year, month, day variable

what: NOTTSHC CDU data science team ggplot2 theme details — ds_theme
title: NOTTSHC CDU data science team ggplot2 theme details — ds_theme
text: Inspired chart layout used TraffordDataLab https://github.com/traffordDataLab/assets/tree/master/theme/ggplot2

title: NOTTSHC CDU data science team ggplot2 theme details — ds_theme
NOTTSHC CDU data science team ggplot2 theme details — ds_theme
text: ggplot2 theme extended details

title: NOTTSHC CDU data science team ggplot2 theme details — ds_theme
text: Zoë Turner

title: NOTTSHC CDU data science team ggplot2 theme details — ds_theme
NOTTSHC CDU data science team ggplot2 theme details — ds_theme
code: # load some data df <- data.frame(  religion = c("Christian", "Buddhist", "Hindu", "Jewish", "Muslim", "Sikh",  "Other Religion", "No Religion", "Not Stated"),  count = c(143639, 768, 2271, 2413, 12994, 1652, 566, 47968, 14307) )  # create a ggplot object plot <- df %>%  dplyr::arrange(count) %>%  dplyr::mutate(religion = factor(religion,                                  levels = religion)) %>%  ggplot2::ggplot(ggplot2::aes(religion, count)) +  ggplot2::geom_col(fill = "#fc6721",                    alpha = 0.8,                    show.legend = FALSE) +  ggplot2::coord_flip() +  ggplot2::labs(x = NULL, y = "Residents",                title = "This is the title of the chart",                subtitle = "This is the subtitle",                caption = "Source: Table KS209EW, Census 2011  |  @DataScienceNott")  # style with the ds_theme putting y axis label and ticks back plot + nottshcMethods::ds_theme()

title: Convert ggplot object into plotly — ggplotly_nottshc

title: Convert ggplot object into plotly — ggplotly_nottshc
text: ggplot ggplot2 object xtitle String, x lab title ytitle String, y lab title aes_txt_tooltip Logical, specifying whether use tooltip display_mode_bar Logical, specifying whether show annoying mode bar plotly, FALSE default!

code: sample_vector(values = c(NA, "Male", "Female", "Other"), weights = c(10, 50, 50, 2), length = 100) #>   [1] "Male"   "Male"   "Female" "Male"   "Female" "Female" "Female" "Male"   #>   [9] "Female" "Male"   "Female" "Male"   NA       NA       "Female" "Male"   #>  [17] "Male"   "Female" "Male"   "Female" "Female" "Male"   "Male"   "Female" #>  [25] "Female" NA       "Female" "Female" NA       "Female" "Female" "Male"   #>  [33] "Male"   "Male"   "Female" "Female" "Male"   "Male"   "Male"   "Female" #>  [41] "Female" NA       "Female" "Male"   "Female" "Female" "Male"   "Male"   #>  [49] "Male"   "Male"   "Male"   "Male"   "Male"   "Male"   "Female" "Male"   #>  [57] "Male"   "Male"   "Female" "Female" "Female" NA       "Male"   "Male"   #>  [65] "Female" "Female" "Male"   "Female" "Female" "Female" "Female" "Male"   #>  [73] "Male"   "Female" "Female" "Male"   "Female" "Female" "Male"   "Male"   #>  [81] "Female" "Female" "Male"   "Male"   "Female" "Female" "Male"   "Male"   #>  [89] "Female" "Male"   "Male"   "Other"  "Male"   "Male"   NA       "Female" #>  [97] "Male"   "Female" "Female" "Male"

what: Function to give the 'yyyy' string to a date column (of formats date, int and character) — year_date
title: Function to give the 'yyyy' string to a date column (of formats date, int and character) — year_date
text: Function give 'yyyy' string date column (formats date, int character)

title: Function to give the 'yyyy' string to a date column (of formats date, int and character) — year_date
Function to give the 'yyyy' string to a date column (of formats date, int and character) — year_date
text: data Dataset date_col Date, date column find latest/earliest. integer (sk synthetic key) converts date format type String, latest gives recent year column whilst earliest gives first

title: Function to give the 'yyyy' string to a date column (of formats date, int and character) — year_date
code: test <- data.frame(  date = sample(seq(as.Date('2007/01/01'), as.Date('2021/01/01'), by = "day"), 12)) %>%  dplyr::mutate(date_sk = as.integer(format(as.Date(date), "%Y%m%d"))) %>%  dplyr::mutate(charc_date = as.character(date))  year_date(test, date, type = "latest") #>   year #> 1 2020 year_date(test, date, type = "earliest") #>   year #> 1 2009  year_date(test, date_sk, type = "latest") #>   year #> 1 2020 year_date(test, date_sk, type = "earliest") #>   year #> 1 2009  year_date(test, charc_date, type = "latest") #>   year #> 1 2020 year_date(test, charc_date, type = "earliest") #>   year #> 1 2009

title: nottshcMethods 0.2.0
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package. usethis::use_github_action(“render-rmarkdown.yaml”) replaced working code another nottshc package
